title: Ticket #1774: The ExitCode attribute is magic, appears to be mostly broken
description:
I've got a 7.4.4 Linux scheduler and 7.0.5 execute nodes. I'm trying to form a on_exit_hold expression that holds jobs that don't exit with a 0 code. The ExitCode is not in the ad after a job completes, but testing if it's undefined returns false. For example: 

  [root@anpvgrd1 log]# condor_q -l 24 | grep -i exit
  ExitStatus = 0
  ExitBySignal = FALSE
  WhenToTransferOutput = "ON_EXIT"
  OnExitHold = isUndefined(ExitCode) != FALSE
  OnExitRemove = isUndefined(ExitCode)
  RequeueReason = "The job attribute OnExitRemove expression 'isUndefined(ExitCode)' evaluated to FALSE"

I would have expected isUndefined(ExitCode) to return True because ExitCode is definitely not in the job's ad. It's un-printable: 

  [root@anpvgrd1 log]# condor_q -f "%s\n" ExitCode
  [root@anpvgrd1 log]#

Un-eval-able: 

  [root@anpvgrd1 log]# condor_q -f "%s\n" 'ExitCode == 0'
  [root@anpvgrd1 log]#

FWIW the following works when my scheduler is Windows and either 7.0.5 or 7.4.4: 

  OnExitHold = (ExitCode != 0)
  OnExitRemove = (ExitCode == 0)

In that case the jobs hold and remove properly according to their ExitCode values. This appears to be some Linux scheduler/Windows execute node anomaly.
